intro: Uvaria leptocladon subsp. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern slender-leaf uvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often pendulous stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to other subspecies of Uvaria leptocladon.
